data.title: Strong Showing By Track & Field At New England Championships
data.meta_description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass. – The Roger Williams University Track & Field team sent nine athletes to compete at the Division-III New England Championships meet on Friday
data.text:
DSPics.com

Men's Track & Field 5/7/2022 6:13:00 PM By Bryce Johnson, Athletic Communications Graduate Assistant

Strong Showing By Track & Field At New England Championships

WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass. – The Roger Williams University Track & Field team sent nine athletes to compete at the Division-III New England Championships meet on Friday and Saturday. No team score was kept but the Hawks put together a strong showing as individuals highlighted by Sam Bielawa (Portsmouth, R.I.), Shirah Strock (Castleton, N.Y.), and the 4x100 meter relay team each claiming ninth-place finishes.

Bielawa capped off an impressive first season in Bristol by grabbing ninth in the Triple Jump with a distance of 13.65m. He also took 14th in the long jump with a leap of 6.54m and was a member of both the RWU relay teams that competed in the event. The 4x100 relay squad consisting of Bielawa, Sean Donovan (Glastonbury, Conn.), Jon Gladstone (Fairfield, Conn.), and Brendan Truman (Vernon, Conn.) took ninth place as a group. Meanwhile, the 4x400m team of Gladstone, Jack Bielawa (Portsmouth, R.I.), Nathan Douglas (Attleboro, Mass.), and Liam Engel (Holliston, Mass.) took 11th with a program-record time of 3:27.31. Douglas also competed individually in the 400-meter dash and finished 15th.

On the women's side, Strock took ninth in the pole vault with a mark of 3.23m to tie the program record for Roger Williams. Meanwhile, Brooke Dutton (Coventry, Conn.) grabbed tenth in discus.

School Records

4X400 Meter Relay

11th: Liam Engel, Jon Gladstone, Jack Bielawa, Nathan Douglas, 3:27.31

Pole Vault

9th: Shirah Strock, 3.23m (tied)

Hawk Highlights

400 Meter Dash

15th: Nathan Douglas, 50.38

4X100 Meter Relay

9th: Sean Donovan, Jon Gladstone, Brendan Truman, Sam Bielawa, 44.46

4X400 Meter Relay

11th: Liam Engel, Jon Gladstone, Jack Bielawa, Nathan Douglas, 3:27.31

Pole Vault

9th: Shirah Strock, 3.23m

Long Jump

14th: Sam Bielawa, 6.54m

Triple Jump

9th: Sam Bielawa,

Discus Throw

9th: Brooke Dutton, 35.44m

Coach's Corner

It was great to see each athlete and relay finished better than their ranking coming into the meet.

They all stepped up in a big way. Nine of the athletes are back next year. We have a great foundation to build off of and it was an excellent way to end the season. I am so very proud of this group performing so well at a high-level meet.

Special thanks to seniors Shirah and Nate. They led the team throughout the entire season and will be sorely missed next season.

What's Next

This concludes the season for the RWU Track & Field teams.
